Senior Backend Developer Job at Myrtle Management Consultants Limited




        
    

        
        Myrtle Management Consultants Limited - Our client is a lean and swift organization, delivering tailor-made logistics solutions to their clients through their dedicated team of professionals..  They have adopted the most efficient cargo handling processes, employing cutting-edge technology solutions, to achieve minimal delay in vessel operations, optimal utilization of terminal area, and the fastest delivery of the cargo.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Backend Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Backend Developer to join their team.
	The successful candidate will play a key role in the design, development, and maintenance of innovative software solutions.
	This role requires excellent technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and the ability to deliver high-quality applications in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities


	Design, develop, test, and deploy secure and scalable applications to support business processes.
	Maintain, enhance, and optimize existing software applications to improve performance and user experience.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and deliver high-quality software solutions.
	Develop and execute SQL queries, stored procedures, and scripts to support data integrity and reporting needs.
	Document application architecture, workflows, and processes for reference, training, and future upgrades.
	Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve application-related issues in a timely manner.
	Ensure compliance with established IT policies, standards, and best practices.
	Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers where required.
	Participate in system reviews, audits, and quality assurance activities.
	Research and recommend innovative tools, frameworks, and technologies to improve development efficiency.


Qualifications
Experience:


	
	Minimum of seven (7) years in software development, with proven expertise in application design, development, and maintenance within a corporate environment.
	


Technical Competencies:


	Proficient in ASP.NET (vb.NET WCF).
	Strong skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript/JQuery, XML, and JSON.
	Advanced knowledge of SQL Server and T-SQL programming.
	Skilled in troubleshooting and technical documentation


Desirable Competencies:


	Knowledge of .NET web services.
	Familiarity with Team Foundation Server (TFS)


Key Attributes:


	Detail-oriented, quality-driven, and results-focused.
	Strong problem-solving and time management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Demonstrated integrity and accountability.


Remuneration
Competitive along with other benefits.

Note


	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Further assessments will be required.

HR / Admin Manager Job at Myrtle Management Consultants Limited




        
    

        
        Myrtle Management Consultants Limited - Our client is a marine logistics service provider in the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry. They offer services in the industry extending beyond the marine segment of the industry to the Subsea and Engineering sectors.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a strategic and results-driven HR/Admin Manager to lead our human resources and administrative functions.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR strategy, compliance, employee relations, and office administration, ensuring the smooth operation of our workforce and office functions.
	This role requires a proactive leader who can foster a positive work environment while aligning HR practices with business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute HR strategies aligned with business goals to enhance workforce productivity and engagement.
	Manage full-cycle recruitment, onboarding, training, and performance management to build a high-performing team.
	Oversee office administration, vendor management, and facility operations to ensure seamless daily activities.
	Develop and manage HR and administrative budgets, optimizing costs while maintaining efficiency.
	Ensure strict compliance with employment laws, company policies, and industry regulations.
	Provide coaching and mentorship to managers on HR-related matters, fostering leadership development.
	Supervise payroll and HR database operations, ensuring accuracy and compliance with local labor laws.
	Oversee corporate certificate renewals, legal documentation, and regulatory compliance requirements.
	Drive employee engagement and talent retention initiatives, creating a positive and inclusive work culture.
	Monitor HR and administrative costs and contribute to budget planning and operational efficiency.
	Design and implement employee well-being programs, including mental health, work-life balance, and career development initiatives.
	Develop and enforce HR policies and procedures, ensuring alignment with best practices and organizational goals.
	Lead succession planning and leadership development programs to build internal capabilities and ensure business continuity.
	Foster a diverse and inclusive workplace by implementing DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) strategies.
	Manage employee grievance procedures, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions with fairness and compliance.
	Partner with senior management to analyze workforce trends and provide strategic HR insights for decision-making.
	Oversee HR technology systems, including HRIS, payroll software, and talent management platforms.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Human Resources
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in HR and administrative management
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM) is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws, HR best practices, and compliance requirements.
	Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and conflict-resolution skills.
	Proficiency in HR software, including NetSuite, SAP SuccessFactors, BambooHR, Workday, and Microsoft Office Suite.


Remuneration
Competitive along with other benefits.

Note


	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Further assessments will be required.

title: Social Media Executive Job at Just Recruitment Agency
content:
Just Recruitment Agency specialized services encompass a wide range of industries, including but not limited to IT, finance, sales, marketing, HR, and more. Whether your company operates in a niche market or a large-scale industry, our freelance recruitment agency have the expertise to source top talent that aligns with your specific requirements.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Executive

Job Location: Opebi - Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Job Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a female Social Media Executive to manage social media presence and digital engagement for one of our clients.
	The ideal candidate is creative, analytical, and experienced in managing business pages across multiple social platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute creative social media campaigns and content plans.
	Manage daily posting across Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, and LinkedIn.
	Create and edit engaging photo, video, and written content.
	Respond to messages, comments, and inquiries professionally.
	Monitor analytics and engagement to improve campaign performance.
	Collaborate with other teams to align online content with brand strategy.
	Stay updated on trends and competitor activities.


Requirements


	Minimum qualification: OND / HND / BSc in Marketing, Mass Communication, or related field.
	2+ years of experience managing social media for a business or brand.
	Skilled in Canva, CapCut, Meta Business Suite, and similar tools.
	Strong writing, design sense, and understanding of digital marketing.
	Data-driven mindset with good knowledge of social media analytics.
	Must be creative, confident, and tech-savvy.
	Must reside within or near Ikeja, Lagos.
	Gender: Female (as requested by the client).


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidayes should send their CV to: jravacancies652@gmail.com using “Social Media Executive – Ikeja” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply
